snippet: Motorbike use by ordinary citizens has been cut to rush hours to ensure fuel for the government and the military personnel, two websites that monitor North Korea said, adding that a decline in Chinese oil imports was probably responsible.
abstract: North Korean officials have reportedly imposed restrictions on private motorbike use in effort to conserve fuel for military and government officials; North Korea suffers chronic fuel shortages.
lead_paragraph: Motorbike use by ordinary citizens has been cut to rush hours to ensure fuel for the government and the military personnel, two websites that monitor North Korea said, adding that a decline in Chinese oil imports was probably responsible.

headline.main: Motorbikers in North Korea Are Told to Park to Save Fuel
headline.print_headline: Motorbikers in North Korea Are Told to Park to Save Fuel
